title: Strabismus
summary: Strabismus is a condition in which the eyes do not properly align with each other when looking at an object.[2] The eye that is focused on an object can alternate.[3] The condition may be present occasionally or constantly.[3] If present during a large part of childhood, it may result in amblyopia or lazy eyes and loss of depth perception.[3] If onset is during adulthood, it is more likely to result in double vision.[3]
